instructions:
Rinse fillets and pat dry, then sprinkle with the lemon juice. Mix the flour, salt, pepper and 1/2 tsp Old
Bay in a shallow dish, and put the cornmeal in a second shallow dish and mix in remaining Old Bay. Dip the
fillets in seasoned flour, then in the milk and finally bread with cornmeal. Refrigerate the breaded fillets for
an hour.
Heat a heavy skillet and add peanut oil. For 1/2 inch fillets fry over medium heat for 3 1/2 minutes on
first side then gently turn and fry for 2 1/2 minutes on second side or until golden brown on both sides. If the
fillets have a skin, fry that side last. Serves 2.
ingredients: 1/2 lb flounder (scrod, haddock or catfish) fillets
name: Corn Meal Fried Fish
